qas.question: What is the definition of Airlift according to the Air Mobility Operations?

answers.text: operations to transport and deliver forces and materiel through the air

qas.question: How does the US employ the global reach capability of airlift?
What does this US presence represent during a humanitarian crisis?

context: Airlift is "<a0_0>operations to transport and deliver forces and materiel through the air<a0_0/> in support of <a1_0>strategic, operational, or tactical<a1_0/> objectives" (AFDD 3–17, Air Mobility Operations). The rapid and flexible options afforded by airlift allow military forces and national leaders the ability to respond and operate in a variety of situations and time frames. The global reach capability of airlift provides the ability to apply US power worldwide by <a2_0>delivering forces to crisis locations<a2_0/>. It serves as a US presence that demonstrates <a3_0>resolve and compassion<a3_0/> in humanitarian crisis.
